result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Demetrius Jerome Simmons #616391 was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 and 6.
Defendant to report to Probation today December 3, 2015 by 1:15 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
Balance of $700.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF154.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as directed by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's. 
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes:
6 months STAYED.
Balance of jail time may be served in Eau Claire County if approved by both Counties in writing and at no expense to St. Croix County.
Defendant must report to jail by December 7, 2015 at 5:00 p.m.
Huber granted for employment and treatment.

supervisions.notes:
-Consecutive to current sentence.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to:
